project_attribute.name: languages
project_attribute.description: List of languages for the source files of this project

project_attribute.name: Compiler_Command
project_attribute.description: The command to compile the source files for a given language
project_attribute.label: compiler

project_attribute.name: gnatlist
project_attribute.description: The gnatls command used to find where the Ada run time files are installed (including optional arguments, e.g. gnatls --RTS=sjlj)
project_attribute.label: Gnatls

project_attribute.name: gnat
project_attribute.description: The gnat driver used to run the various commands associated with the GNAT toolchain
project_attribute.label: Gnat

project_attribute.name: debugger_command
project_attribute.description: The command line to use when debugging applications (including optional arguments). Only gdb and its variants are currently supported
project_attribute.label: Debugger

project_attribute.name: global_configuration_pragmas
project_attribute.description: External file that contains the configuration pragmas to use for Ada sources. This file will be used both for this project and all its imported projects
project_attribute.label: Global pragmas

project_attribute.name: local_configuration_pragmas
project_attribute.description: External file that contains the configuration pragmas to use for Ada sources in this project. This is the combined with the pragmas found in the Global pragmas attribute of the root project
project_attribute.label: Local pragmas

project_attribute.name: program_host
project_attribute.description: Name or IP address of the embedded target. This field should be left blank if you are not working on an embedded application
project_attribute.label: Program host

project_attribute.name: communication_protocol
project_attribute.description: Protocol used to connect to the embedded target. This field should be left blank if you are not working on an embedded application
project_attribute.label: Protocol

project_attribute.name: vcs_kind
project_attribute.description: Name of the version control system that you are using
project_attribute.label: System

project_attribute.name: vcs_log_check
project_attribute.description: Application run on the log file/revision history just before commiting a file. If it returns anything other than 0, the commit will not be performed. The only parameter to this script is the name of the log file
project_attribute.label: Log checker

project_attribute.name: vcs_file_check
project_attribute.description: Application run on the source file just before commiting a file. If it returns anything other than 0, the commit will not be performed. The only parameter to this script is the name of the source file
project_attribute.label: File checker

project_attribute.name: vcs_repository_root
project_attribute.description: The repository root path
project_attribute.label: Repository

project_attribute.name: vcs_patch_root
project_attribute.description: The root directory to use for building patch file. The root project directory is used if this value is not defined.
project_attribute.label: Patch

project_attribute.name: source_dirs
project_attribute.description: List of directories that contain the source files. You can specify that a directory and all its subdirectories should be included by checking the Recursive checkbox

project_attribute.name: source_list_file
project_attribute.description: Name of a file that contains the list of source files for this project. The names should appear one per line. The names should not include any directory information, since this is taken from the list of source directories. This attribute is ignored if an explicit list of sources is given.
project_attribute.label: Source list file

project_attribute.name: source_files
project_attribute.description: List of source files for this project. These are the base name of the files, and should not include any directory information. This attribute is not compatible with Source List File.

project_attribute.name: locally_removed_files
project_attribute.label: files
project_attribute.description: List of source files from the extended project that should no longer be visible to the compiler when compiling the extending project. This can be used for instance when a source file has become obsolete due to other changes in the project

project_attribute.name: object_dir
project_attribute.description: The name of the directories in which the files generated by the compiler will be put. This include object files and any other file that your compiler generates as a by-product of the compilation. If you need multiple object directories, you must create multiple project files that import each other
project_attribute.label: Build directory

project_attribute.name: exec_dir
project_attribute.description: Directory in which the executable will be copied. By default, this is the same as the object directory, and doesn't need to be further specified
project_attribute.label: Exec directory

project_attribute.name: main
project_attribute.description: List of source files that contain the application's entry point. These units will appear in the Build menu, so that you can easily share a single project hierarchy to build a whole set of applications

project_attribute.name: executable_suffix
project_attribute.label: Default suffix
project_attribute.description: The default suffix for executables generated by the builder. This default can be overriden by modifying the list of executable names below.

project_attribute.name: executable
project_attribute.description: Name of the executable generated when compiling each of the main units

project_attribute.name: library_name
project_attribute.label: Library Name
project_attribute.description: Name of the library that will contain all the object files from this project. You must chose a name which is valid for your platform.

project_attribute.name: library_dir
project_attribute.label: Library Directory
project_attribute.description: Directory in which the library will be copied as a result of the compilation. Some extra files will be copied in this directory as well, for instance the ALI file for Ada sources. This directory must be different from the object directory

project_attribute.name: library_ali_dir
project_attribute.label: Library ALI Directory
project_attribute.description: Directory in which the ALI files needed by the GNAT compiler will be copied when the library is installed. By default, this will be the same as the Library Directory. This attribute requires a recent version of GNAT

project_attribute.name: library_kind
project_attribute.label: Library Kind
project_attribute.description: The kind of library that should be built. If you need to build different kinds of libraries, it is recommend to select a different library directory for each, since the object files might need to be compiled differently in each case

project_attribute.name: library_version
project_attribute.label: Version
project_attribute.description: The version of the library. This is a platform depend string, and you should make sure it is valid for your platform.

project_attribute.name: linker_options
project_attribute.label: Linker options
project_attribute.description: Additional linker switches used when linking an executable. This attribute is ignored in the main project, and only used from dependent projects.

project_attribute.name: externally_built
project_attribute.label: Externally Built
project_attribute.description: Set this attribute to True if the compiler should not check whether the library is up-to-date. As a result, the sources do not need to be available, apart of course for the spec files and the bodies of generic packages

project_attribute.name: library_interface
project_attribute.label: Interface
project_attribute.description: This attribute is optional. If it is defined, it should contain the list of units that are the public interface to the library. All other units will not be accessible by users of the library. If this attribute is defined, the library will be a standalone library.

project_attribute.name: library_auto_init
project_attribute.label: Auto Init
project_attribute.description: If this attribute is true, then the standalone library will be automatically initialized when part of the project. If this attribute is false, you need to call some special elaboration code yourself. You must define the interface to the library as well.

project_attribute.name: library_src_dir
project_attribute.label: Source directory
project_attribute.description: The directory in which the sources required for Ada clients of the library will be copied. This include public interfaces, as well as bodies for inline subprograms,... This directory can be the same as the library directory, but must be different from the object directory
